definition[0]: to put something inside an envelope as well as a letter
example[0]: Please enclose a cheque with your order.
example[1]: Please find enclosed an agenda for the meeting.
definition[1]: to surround something, especially with a fence or wall, in order to make it separate
example[2]: The pool area is enclosed by a six-foot wall.
explanation[0]: Enclose is usually passive in this meaning
